review:
Been playing since the first Overwatch and I have to say this game is amazing!

Don't let the other reviews discourage you from trying it out! (most are salty)
Ahem removing lootboxes and being able to choose what skin I wanna buy is the best idea yet!

This game is fun and always intense!

Especially with friends definitely a 9 outta 10!

was a shit game

shit game

I'm not gonna waste your time here.
I've played since 2016 and the game itself is good/fun, [b]HOWEVER[/b] the current developers have little to no respect for the player base, the game is riddled with bugs (characters like Doomfist are literally unplayable because of this) and has massive balancing issues.
The current direction the devs are going in leaves me with little to no confidence in the games future, I absolutely cannot recommend it to new or returning players. The glory days of Overwatch ended in 2019. 2020 onward has just been the devs beating a dead horse.
If u wanna play it, go for it, knock yourself out. [b]Just please do not pay for anything!!![/b]

NÃ£o dÃ¡ para pegar a nova hero no BP Free. 70 conto sÃ³ para jogar as missÃµes. Rola nÃ£o.

I've been fortunate/unfortunate enough to have been playing this game since it's beta. It's like watching a loved one slowly die in front of your eyes, in the end bearing little to no resemblance to the thing you once loved.  To anyone thinking about getting involved in this game, here are some things to consider...

- The game has become microtransaction hell, with new heroes and any decent cosmetics being locked behind either a battlepass or a beefy paywall. We're talking $20 skins here. 
- It fosters one of the most toxic communities. The game requires all players to pull their weight, so new players are often flagged for throwing when they're just trying to learn the game. Since the game switched to free-to-play, players banned for abusive chat end up just making an alternate account and continue to flame. Which leads me to my next point...
- COMMUNITY REPORTS ARE HANDLED BY BOTS. Meaning if you're reported enough times by people, regardless of whatever happened, you'll eventually get suspended and then banned. So if you are A.) a newb trying to learn the game or B.) a white-knight calling out a team of white-supremacists then you can kiss all your cosmetics and hours goodbye. 
- Not to mention the numerous empty promises from developers, completely tone-deaf character changes, horrible balancing issues, a dying/dead competitive scene and the most toxic competitive match-making in any game.

In summary, the only person who can save Overwatch is Jeff Kaplin. But alas, he remains beyond our reach having feared what he created. May Jeffrey save us all.

2016å¹´
The Game Awards 2016
